content:
Sure! Here are the modified diagrams, with additional methods for each class:

1. Super Class "User" and Subclasses "Student", "Professor", and "Administrator"
```sql
        +--------------+
        |     User     |
        +--------------+
                ^
                |
+---------------+---------------+
|               |               |
|          +--------+     +-----------+
|          |Student |     |  Professor|
|          +--------+     +-----------+
|                ^               ^
|                |               |
|         +------------+   +-------------+
|         |Administrator|   |  Professor  |
|         +------------+   +-------------+
|+---------------------------------------+
||- username: str                        |
||- password: str                        |
||- email: str                           |
||- first_name: str                      |
||- last_name: str                       |
|+---------------------------------------+
||+create_account()                      |
||+delete_account()                      |
||+login()                               |
||+logout()                              |
||+reset_password()                      |
||+edit_profile()                        |
|+---------------------------------------+
```
1. Class Diagram for "Class Schedule"
```lua
        +----------------+
        |  ClassSchedule |
        +----------------+
        |                |
        |+---------------+
        ||- start_time: datetime |
        ||- end_time: datetime   |
        ||- day_of_week: str     |
        ||- location: str        |
        ||- course_code: str     |
        ||- course_name: str     |
        |+---------------+
        ||+add_schedule()       |
        ||+remove_schedule()    |
        ||+edit_schedule()      |
        |+---------------+
```
1. Class Diagram for "Board"
```lua
        +---------+
        |   Board |
        +---------+
        |         |
        |+--------+
        ||- title: str |
        ||- body: str  |
        ||- date: datetime |
        ||- type: str  |
        |+--------+
        ||+add_post() |
        ||+delete_post() |
        ||+edit_post() |
        ||+view_post() |
        |+--------+
```
1. Class Diagram for "Student"
```lua
        +---------+
        | Student |
        +---------+
        |         |
        |+--------+
        ||- name: str  |
        ||- id: str    |
        ||- major: str |
        |+--------+
        ||+view_schedule() |
        ||+join_club()     |
        ||+leave_club()    |
        ||+post_on_board() |
        |+--------+
```
1. Class Diagram for "Professor"
```lua
        +------------+
        | Professor  |
        +------------+
        |            |
        |+-----------+
        ||- name: str    |
        ||- id: str      |
        ||- subject: str |
        |+-----------+
        ||+view_schedule() |
        ||+create_post()   |
        ||+delete_post()   |
        ||+edit_post()     |
        |+-----------+
```
Note: Again, these are just some examples of the methods that each class might have in the Everytime application, and there could be other methods depending on the specific requirements and use cases.
